New Records: Shubman Gill scored 66 off 49, the highest individual score in the match.
Ruturaj Gaikwad scored 49 off 28, contributing significantly to India's total.
Dion Myers scored 65 not out off 49, the highest score for Zimbabwe in the match.
Key Match Events: India's batting order saw Yashasvi Jaiswal, Shubman Gill, Abhishek Sharma, and Ruturaj Gaikwad in the top four positions.
Zimbabwe's Wessly Madhevere and Dion Myers formed a crucial 77-run stand for the third wicket.
Washington Sundar took three wickets, contributing to India's bowling success.
Pre-Game Insights: India made several selection calls, including playing Yashasvi Jaiswal, Sanju Samson, and Shivam Dube, while leaving out Riyan Parag.
Zimbabwe's bowlers, led by Sikandar Raza and Blessing Muzarabani, struggled with fielding and extra runs.
Post-Match Reflections: India secured back-to-back victories after losing the series opener, showing their resilience.
Zimbabwe's batting performance, despite efforts from Dion Myers and Clive Madande, was not enough to win the match.
